title.narrative: CHILD PROTECTION SYSTEM HAS ENHANCED CAPACITY TO PROVIDE COMMUNITY-BASED SUPPORT

description.narrative: Child protection system has an enhanced capacity to provide community-based support services and measures targeting children deprived of parental care, children living in families experiencing multiple deprivations, and preventing separation, which contributes to Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, an increased number of boys and girls benefit from child protection interventions aimed at preventing, adequately detecting, referring and responding to violence and abuse

sector.narrative: Child protection focused on care and support for children with disabilities
Parent/caregiver education and programmes on violence, exploitation and abuse - across the life cycle
Services to prevent or respond to violence, exploitation and abuse
Social and behaviour change communication on violence, exploitation and abuse

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Child protection system has an enhanced capacity to provide community-based support services and measures targeting childrendeprived of parental care, children living in families experiencing multiple deprivations, and preventing separation

description.narrative: All children deprived of parental care now live in a family-based or family-like environment, and system is improved to ensure quality family-based alternative care for children. In response to the disruptions caused by the COVID-19 pandemic, UNICEF ensured that mental health and social work services, either online or outreach, are available to all children and families in need, particularly to the most vulnerable, including children deprived of parental care and children with disabilities. | Status:Met | As-of Date:15/01/2021
